items.name: This Site!
items.description: A responsive portfolio website showcasing skills, projects, and experiences.
longDescription: This project was created to display my portfolio in an engaging and modern way. It features a responsive design, interactive elements, and showcases my skills and experiences in software development.
Used React, Javascript and Vercel as deployment of website.
Built in under 24 hours to give myself the challenge of it.

items.name: BuffBuddy
items.description: A CLI application to help users track their fitness journeys.
longDescription: BuffBuddy is a Command Line Interface (CLI) application designed to track workouts, meals, and water intake, providing a simple yet effective tool for anyone starting their fitness journey.
Developed the application using Object-Oriented Programming principles, ensuring functionality was well-encapsulated and scalable for future enhancements.
Implemented the save and load feature using the Gson library, enabling seamless reading and writing of custom data types in JSON files for reliable data management.
Designed and coded an intuitive water tracking feature to make hydration tracking simple and user-friendly.
Contributed to debugging and resolving application issues to improve functionality and user experience.
Collaborated with teammates by providing design suggestions that prioritized minimal coupling for a cleaner and more maintainable architecture.
Created UML diagrams and wrote markdown documentation to effectively communicate the application's structure and usage.

items.name: Vertical Immersion Cooling
items.description: Served as the lead engineer in a startathon, designed a modular immersion cooling system for better accessibility.
longDescription: This project aims to revolutionize server cooling by developing vertical immersion systems, addressing challenges in traditional horizontal designs. The modular design improves accessibility, scalability, and sustainability for data centers.

Led the engineering effort during a startathon to create a feasible vertical immersion cooling design, tackling challenges like load capacity from vertical liquid orientation and maintenance issues with stacked servers.
Utilized modular and loosely coupled system design philosophies to make immersion cooling more cost-efficient, scalable, and easier to adopt.
Currently designing a new layout for immersion-ready servers to optimize space and reduce the amount of coolant needed, reimagining servers to be more compact and efficient.

The goal is to reduce resource wastage in data centers and promote sustainability, especially as AI adoption increases energy demands, by pushing forward energy-efficient and cost-effective immersion cooling systems.

items.name: E-Mini Mart
items.description: Developed a digital e-commerce solution during a hackathon.
longDescription: Led frontend development and UI/UX design for an E-Mini Mart web app during the Hack4Good Hackathon, creating a user-friendly marketplace, an efficient checkout system, and a robust admin dashboard for managing stock and transactions.
Implemented real-time updates using Redux to ensure seamless synchronization of user actions and database changes without requiring page refreshes.
Built a scalable and intuitive interface using React and Mantine, optimizing usability for both teenage users and administrators.

items.name: Alex the Rescue Bot
items.description: A robot designed for search and rescue operations.
longDescription: Alex the Rescue Robot is a robot built using Raspberry Pi 4 and Arduino, designed to remotely navigate through environments in search of victims to save.
Utilized SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) to map and navigate the maze in real-time, ensuring precise movement and efficient exploration.
Implemented ROS (Robot Operating System) for modular control and communication between sensors, actuators, and navigation systems, enabling seamless coordination.
Developed an exclusive feature using a gyroscope to achieve precise turns, making Alex one of the fastest robots to complete the maze.
Focused on the color detection system, writing robust code that used ratio-based color comparison to ensure accuracy regardless of lighting conditions.

items.name: Ryan the Maze Runner
items.description: A robot designed to navigate mazes autonomously.
longDescription: Ryan is a maze-solving robot powered by Arduino and mBot sensors, designed to calculate and navigate the optimal path through a maze with precision.
Implemented and refined algorithms for line detection and color detection to ensure accurate pathfinding and obstacle identification.
Focused extensively on developing a reliable color detection system, optimizing it to adapt to varying environmental conditions for consistent performance.
Assembled the robot hardware, integrating sensors and ensuring seamless interaction between mechanical and software components.
Achieved a top 10% finish in competition timings, making Ryan one of the fastest robots to complete the maze.

items.name: Obstacle Robot
items.description: A robot designed to overcome a set of obstacles.
longDescription: Designed and built a lightweight bootstrap robot using innovative materials like cardboard, popsicle sticks, and breadboards to overcome a set of engineering challenges.
Proposed and implemented a rocket launcher system, replacing the traditional catapult to enhance precision and reliability.
Wrote the movement control code using driver chips, enabling smooth forward and backward motion.
Assembled the robot's electrical components with a focus on achieving accurate and stable connections.
Achieved the lightest weight in the tutorial group by using creative design decisions, such as utilizing cardboard wheels to save 5g per wheel.
Served as the main video editor, producing a compelling project video.

items.name: Pet Comms
items.description: A pet communication system for my pet to call me whenever.
longDescription: Pet Comms is an ongoing project to develop a communication system that bridges the gap between pets and their owners, enabling interaction through a user-friendly interface from anywhere in the world.
The system is being built using Raspberry Pi 4, a 5-inch screen, speaker module, and microphone module, with a custom app to facilitate seamless communication.
A CAD model for the exterior housing is in progress, focusing on functionality, durability, and aesthetics to integrate all hardware components effectively.
The project includes designing and deploying a mobile app with an intuitive interface to make it easy for owners to connect and interact with their pets.
Future plans involve incorporating additional features such as a toy launcher for remote physical interaction and making the system mobile to enhance versatility and engagement during playtime.
